title: Elimination_Chamber:_Toronto
summary: The article is about the WWE Elimination Chamber: Toronto event scheduled for March 1, 2025, at Rogers Centre. It details the event's key matches, including John Cena winning the men's Elimination Chamber match and Bianca Belair winning the women's match, both earning championship opportunities at WrestleMania 41.
extract: Elimination Chamber: Toronto was a 2025 professional wrestling event produced by the American company WWE. It was the 15th Elimination Chamber event and took place on Saturday, March 1, 2025, at Rogers Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The event aired via pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming and featured wrestlers from the promotion's brand divisions Raw, SmackDown, and one wrestler from NXT. The event is based around the Elimination Chamber match, a type of multi-person elimination-based Steel Cage match in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake.

{{short description|2025 WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming event}} {{pp|small=yes}} {{use mdy dates|date=November 2024}} {{Infobox wrestling event |name = Elimination Chamber: Toronto |image = Elimination Chamber - Toronto poster.jpg |caption = Promotional poster featuring [[John Cena]] |tagline = |promotion = [[WWE]] |brand = [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]]
[[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] |date = March 1, 2025 |attendance = 38,493{{cite web|url=https://www.pwtorch.com/site/2025/03/01/wwe-elimination-chamber-results-3-1-kellers-report-on-mens-and-womens-chamber-matches-sami-zayn-vs-kevin-owens-cody-rhodes-answering-rocks-offer-more/|title=WWE Elimination Chambe results (3/1): Keller's report on Men's and Women's Chamber matches, Sami Zayn vs. Kevin Owens, Cody Rhodes answering Rock's offer, more|date=March 1, 2025|last=Keller|first=Wade|work=[[PWTorch]]|access-date=March 1, 2025}} |venue = [[Rogers Centre]] |city = [[Toronto]], Ontario, Canada |wwenlast = [[NXT Vengeance Day (2025)|Vengeance Day]] |wwennext = [[NXT Stand & Deliver (2025)|Stand & Deliver]] |event = [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] |lastevent2 = [[Elimination Chamber: Perth|Perth]] |nextevent2 = |event2 = [[WWE in Canada]] |lastevent3 = [[Survivor Series: WarGames (2024)]] |nextevent3 = }} '''Elimination Chamber: Toronto''' (known as '''No Escape: Toronto''' in Germany) was a 2025 [[professional wrestling]] [[List of WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming supercards|event]] produced by the American company [[WWE]]. It was the 15th [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] event and took place on Saturday, March 1, 2025, at [[Rogers Centre]] in [[Toronto]], Ontario, Canada. The event aired via [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) and [[livestreaming]] and featured wrestlers from the promotion's [[WWE brand extension|brand divisions]] [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]], [[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]], and one wrestler from [[NXT (WWE brand)|NXT]]. The event is based around the [[Elimination Chamber]] match, a type of multi-person elimination-based [[Steel Cage match]] in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake. The event comprised four matches, including two Elimination Chamber matches, one each for the men and women. The main event was the men's eponymous match, which was won by [[John Cena]], earning a match for SmackDown's [[Undisputed WWE Championship]] at [[WrestleMania 41]], while the women's match, which was the opening bout, was won by SmackDown's [[Bianca Belair]], earning a match for Raw's [[Women's World Championship (WWE)|Women's World Championship]] at WrestleMania. In another prominent match, Canada native [[Kevin Owens]] defeated fellow Canadian [[Sami Zayn]] in an [[unsanctioned match]]. The event also saw the returns of [[Randy Orton]] and [[Jade Cargill]]. The event was also notable for Cena's final Elimination Chamber appearance due to his retirement from professional wrestling at the end of 2025, as well as his [[Heel (professional wrestling)|heel turn]], as Cena had portrayed a [[Face (professional wrestling)|babyface]] since 2003. This was the first Elimination Chamber event in Toronto and the first WWE event to be held at Rogers Centre since [[WrestleMania X8]] in 2002 when it was still known as the SkyDome. It was also the second Elimination Chamber event in Canada after the [[Elimination Chamber (2023)|2023 edition]] and the fourth consecutive Elimination Chamber to be held outside of the United States. This was also the first PPV to not feature a championship defense since [[Survivor Series (2021)|Survivor Series in 2021]]. ==Production== [[File:Toronto - ON - Rogers Centre2.jpg|thumb|upright|250px|The 2025 [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] was held at Rogers Centre in Toronto, [[Ontario]], Canada, which was WWE's first event in the stadium since [[WrestleMania X8]] in 2002.]] ===Background=== [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] is a [[professional wrestling]] [[List of WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming supercards|event]] first produced by the American promotion WWE in 2010. It has been held every year since, except in 2016, generally in February. The [[Gimmick (professional wrestling)|concept]] of the event is that one or two [[Card (sports)#Main event|main event matches]] are contested inside the [[Elimination Chamber]], which is a type of multi-person elimination-based [[Steel Cage match]] in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake.{{cite web|url=https://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2010/exclusives/chamberrules|title=Elimination Chamber Match rules|access-date=February 2, 2010|work=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110208084141/https://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/history/2010/exclusives/chamberrules|archive-date=Februar

title: Gervonta_Davis
summary: This article provides a comprehensive profile of Gervonta "Tank" Davis, an American professional boxer who currently holds the WBA lightweight title and has previously held multiple championship belts across different weight classes. As of May 2024, Davis is ranked as one of the world's top lightweight boxers according to major boxing authorities, including being ranked first by the Transnational Boxing Rankings Board.
extract: Gervonta Bryant Davis, also known by his nickname "Tank", is an American professional boxer. He has held the World Boxing Association (WBA) lightweight title since 2023, having previously held the Regular version from 2019 to 2023. He also held the International Boxing Federation (IBF) super featherweight title in 2017, the WBA super featherweight title twice between 2018 and 2020, and the WBA super lightweight title in 2021.

title: Lamont_Roach_Jr.
summary: This article is about Lamont Roach Jr., an American professional boxer who has held the WBA super featherweight title since 2023. It details his career trajectory from his decorated amateur background, including Golden Gloves championships, to his professional career with Golden Boy Promotions, highlighting his path to eventually winning a world title after an earlier unsuccessful championship attempt.

'''Lamont Roach Jr.''' (born August 18, 1995) is an American [[professional boxer]] who has held the [[World Boxing Association|WBA]] [[super featherweight]] title since 2023.

Roach was a decorated [[amateur boxing|amateur]], winning gold medals at the [[National Golden Gloves]] and USA Boxing Youth National Championships in 2013. He made his professional debut the following year, shortly after signing with [[Golden Boy Promotions]], while studying at the [[University of Maryland]]. He went undefeated in his first 20 fights (19 wins, 1 draw), collecting three minor belts before he unsuccessfully challenged [[Jamel Herring]] for his [[list of WBO world champions#Junior lightweight|WBO super featherweight title]] in 2019.

==Early life==
Born in [[Washington, D.C.]], Roach was raised in [[Upper Marlboro, Maryland]]. When he was nine years old, he accompanied his father and his cousin to No “X” Cuse Boxing Club in [[Capitol Heights, Maryland|Capitol Heights]], where he got to hit a [[punching bag]] for the first time and learn some of the basics of boxing.<ref name="dbk">{{cite news|url=https://dbknews.com/2016/08/12/article_a044d7a8-cb6c-11e3-b996-001a4bcf6878-html/|title=Getting in the ring: Lamont Roach Jr. goes pro while still student|publisher=[[The Diamondback]]|date=August 12, 2016|access-date=May 20, 2020}}</ref> He enjoyed it so much that he decided to continue training under his father and his cousin Bernard, and by middle school was in the gym five times a week. Although he had also been playing [[American football|football]] throughout his youth, he dropped it to focus on boxing once he reached high school.<ref name=dbk/>

As an amateur, his record was {{abbr|125–15|125 wins, 15 losses}},<ref name="WBC">{{cite news|url=https://roundbyroundboxing.com/lamont-roach-jr-has-sights-set-on-wbc-title-this-saturday/amp/|title=Lamont Roach Jr. Has Sights Set on WBC Title This Saturday|publisher=Round by Round Boxing|first=Peter|last=Nieves|date=January 25, 2017|access-date=May 26, 2020}}{{Dead link|date=September 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> with two of those losses coming from [[Gervonta Davis]].<ref name="ready">{{cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/lamont-roach-ready-title-shot-beating-mercado--134697|title=Lamont Roach Ready For Title Shot After Beating Mercado|publisher=Boxing Scene|first=Lem|last=Satterfield|date=December 17, 2018|access-date=May 27, 2020}}</ref> He won two Junior National Golden Gloves Championships, a national PAL Championship and five Ringside World Championships. In 2013, he was the USA Boxing Youth National Champion and the [[List of US national Golden Gloves lightweight champions|National Golden Gloves champion]], both at {{convert|132|lb|kg}}. He also claimed a bronze medal at the Klitschko Brothers Tournament in [[Ukraine]] and was honored with the USA Boxing Outstanding Boxer award for his performances that year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.goldenboypromotions.com/fighter_profiles/lamont-roach-jr/|title=Fighter Profile|publisher=[[Golden Boy Promotions]]|access-date=May 26, 2020|archive-date=September 14, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200914184005/https://www.goldenboypromotions.com/fighter_profiles/lamont-roach-jr/|url-status=dead}}</ref>

==Professional career==
In March 2014, he signed with [[Golden Boy Promotions]] to begin his professional career with his father Lamont Sr. serving as his manager.<ref name=dbk/> Roach made his professional debut on April 19, 2014, defeating Victor Galindo by [[unanimous decision]] at the [[D.C. Armory]]. Just 18 years old at the time, he was still a freshman at the [[University of Maryland]] studying [[mechanical engineering]], following in his father's footsteps.<ref name=dbk/> Two months later, he defeated Miguel Antonio Rodríguez in [[Boston]] when his opponent failed to answer the bell for the second round.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://stiffjab.com/danny-kelly-lamont-roach-jr-win-in-boston-on-fs1-2318da4d117b|title=Danny Kelly, Lamont Roach Jr Win In Boston on FS1|publisher=Stiff Jab|first=Gautham|last=Nagesh|date=June 6, 2014|access-date=May 26, 2020}}{{dead link|date=February 2025|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> In his first televised match he faced Herbert Quartey, cousin of former world champion [[Ike Quartey]], in [[Philadelphia]] on January 20, 20

title: WrestleMania_41
summary: This article provides information about WrestleMania 41, which will be held as a two-night event on April 19-20, 2025, at Allegiant Stadium in Paradise, Nevada. The event will mark several firsts, including being the first WrestleMania to stream on Netflix internationally, the first to fall on Easter weekend, and will feature John Cena's final WrestleMania match before his retirement.
extract: WrestleMania 41, also promoted as WrestleMania Vegas, is an upcoming 2025 professional wrestling event produced by WWE. It will be the 41st annual WrestleMania and will take place as a two-night event on Saturday, April 19, and Sunday, April 20, 2025, at Allegiant Stadium in Paradise, Nevada. This will be the second WrestleMania to take place in the Las Vegas area, after WrestleMania IX in 1993, which was held at Caesars Palace. The event will air via pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming and will feature wrestlers from the promotion's Raw and SmackDown brand divisions.
text:
{{pp|small=yes}} {{short description|2025 WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming event}} {{use mdy dates|date=May 2024}} {{Redirect-multi|2|WrestleMania Las Vegas|WrestleMania Vegas|the previous WrestleMania held in Las Vegas|WrestleMania IX}}{{Infobox Wrestling event |name = WrestleMania 41 |image = WrestleMania 41 poster.jpg |caption = Ticket sales poster featuring various WWE wrestlers |tagline = |promotion = [[WWE]] |brand = [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]]
[[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] |date = April 19–20, 2025 |attendance = |venue = [[Allegiant Stadium]] |city = [[Paradise, Nevada]] |wwenlast = [[NXT Stand & Deliver (2025)|Stand & Deliver]] |wwennext = |event = [[WrestleMania]] |lastevent2 = [[WrestleMania XL|XL]] |nextevent2 = [[WrestleMania 42|42]] }} '''WrestleMania 41''', also promoted as '''WrestleMania Vegas''', is an upcoming 2025 [[professional wrestling]] [[List of WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming supercards|event]] produced by [[WWE]]. It will be the 41st annual [[WrestleMania]] and will take place as a two-night event on Saturday, April 19, and Sunday, April 20, 2025, at [[Allegiant Stadium]] in [[Paradise, Nevada]]. This will be the second WrestleMania to take place in the [[Las Vegas]] area, after [[WrestleMania IX]] in 1993, which was held at [[Caesars Palace]]. The event will air via [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) and [[livestreaming]] and will feature wrestlers from the promotion's [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]] and [[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] [[WWE brand extension|brand divisions]]. This will be the first WrestleMania to livestream on [[Netflix]] in most international markets, following the [[WWE Network]]'s merger under the platform in January 2025 in those areas. This will also be the first WrestleMania to be held during [[Easter]] weekend. The event will also feature [[John Cena]]'s final WrestleMania match in his 23-year career due to his retirement from professional wrestling at the end of 2025. == Production == === Background === [[File:Allegiant Stadium (cropped).jpg|thumb|The event will be held at [[Allegiant Stadium]] in the [[Las Vegas]] suburb of [[Paradise, Nevada]].]] [[WrestleMania]] is [[WWE]]'s flagship [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) and [[livestreaming]] event, having first been held in [[WrestleMania I|1985]]. It was the company's first PPV produced and was also WWE's first major event available via livestreaming when the company launched the [[WWE Network]] in February 2014. It is the longest-running event in WWE history and is held annually between mid-March to mid-April, featuring wrestlers from WWE's [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]] and [[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] [[WWE brand extension|brand divisions]].{{cite web| last1=Benigno|first1=Anthony|last2=Clapp|first2=John|date=April 3, 2013| title=WrestleMania 29 press conference brings WWE to Radio City Music Hall| url=https://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/29/wrestlemania-press-conference-radio-city-music-hall|work=[[WWE]]|access-date=March 31, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130407013602/https://www.wwe.com/shows/wrestlemania/29/wrestlemania-press-conference-radio-city-music-hall|archive-date=April 7, 2013|url-status=live|quote=... WWE's flagship event lights up MetLife Stadium ... WrestleMania}} Along with [[Royal Rumble]], [[SummerSlam]], [[Survivor Series]], and [[WWE Money in the Bank|Money in the Bank]], it is one of the company's five biggest events of the year, referred to as the "Big Five".Ian Hamilton. ''Wrestling's Sinking Ship: What Happens to an Industry Without Competition'' (p. 160){{cite web |title=Las Vegas to host WWE's Money in the Bank in 2022|url=https://news3lv.com/news/local/las-vegas-to-host-wwes-money-in-the-bank-in-2022|website=[[KSNV]] |access-date=May 31, 2022|date=August 22, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210823161938/https://news3lv.com/news/local/las-vegas-to-host-wwes-money-in-the-bank-in-2022|archive-date=August 23, 2021|url-status=live}}{{cite web|title=WWE Announces Dates And Location For WrestleMania 40|date=July 27, 2022|url=https://www.fightful.com/wrestling/wwe-announces-dates-and-location-wrestlemania-40|first=Jeremy|last=Lambert|work=Fightful|access-date=July 27, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220727142226/https://www.fightful.com/wrestling/wwe-announces-dates-and-location-wrestlemania-40|archive-date=July 27, 2022|url-status=live}} WrestleMania was ranked the sixth-most valuable sports brand in the world by ''[[Forbes]]'',{{cite magazine| url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mikeozanian/2019/10/16/the-forbes-fab-40-puma-debuts-on-2019-list-of-the-worlds-most-valuable-sports-brands/?sh=79efef21d

title: Tate_McRae
summary: This Wikipedia extract provides biographical information about Tate McRae, a Canadian singer, songwriter, and dancer born in 2003 who first gained prominence on "So You Think You Can Dance" before launching a successful music career with hits like "Greedy" and "You Broke Me First." The article outlines her musical journey from her early EPs to her commercially successful studio albums, highlighting her evolution into a chart-topping pop artist.
extract: Tate Rosner McRae is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and dancer. She first gained prominence as the first Canadian finalist on the American reality television series So You Think You Can Dance (2016). She was later signed by RCA Records after gaining traction for her 2017 debut song "One Day". She went on to release two extended plays (EPs), All the Things I Never Said (2020) and Too Young to Be Sad (2021). The latter was the most streamed female EP of 2021 on Spotify and was preceded by the single "You Broke Me First", which peaked within the top ten of the Canadian Hot 100 and the top ten of the US Billboard Hot 100.

title: Varun_Chakravarthy
summary: The article is about Varun Chakravarthy Vinod, an Indian international cricketer born in 1991 who plays for Tamil Nadu in domestic cricket and Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL as a leg spin bowler. He made his T20I debut in July 2021 and notably became the second oldest player after Farookh Engineer to debut in One Day International cricket for India in February 2025.

He made his T20I international debut in July 2021 and became the second oldest player after Farookh Engineer to debut in ODI in February 2025 for the Indian cricket team.

'''Varun Chakravarthy Vinod''' (born 29 August 1991) is an Indian [[International cricket|international]] [[cricket]]er who plays for [[Tamil Nadu cricket team|Tamil Nadu]] in domestic cricket and [[Kolkata Knight Riders]] in the [[Indian Premier League]] (IPL) as a [[leg spin]] bowler. He made his [[Twenty20 International|T20I]] international debut in July 2021 and became the second oldest player after [[Farookh Engineer]] to debut in [[One Day International|ODI]] in February 2025 for the [[India national cricket team|Indian cricket team]].<ref name="Bio">{{Cite web|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/ci/content/player/1108375.html |title=Varun Chakravarthy |access-date=20 September 2018 |work=ESPNcricinfo}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/story/_/id/25564543/varun-chakravarthy |title=Decoding the mystery: Who is Varun Chakravarthy? |work=ESPNcricinfo |access-date=8 January 2018|date=8 January 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Cracks to craftsmanship: Varun Chakravarthy redesigns his Dubai story |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/story/champions-trophy-varun-chakravarthy-dubai-architect-redemption-india-vs-new-zealand-2687942-2025-03-03 |website=India Today |language=en-In |date=3 March 2025}}</ref>

==Early life==
Varun Chakravarthy Vinod was born on 29 August 1991 in [[Bidar]], [[Karnataka]]. His father Vinod Chakravarthy, an [[Indian Telecommunications Service|ITS]] officer for [[BSNL]], is half-[[Tamils|Tamil]] and half-[[Malayalis|Malayali]], while his mother Malini is a [[Kannadiga]]. He was brought up in [[Adyar, Chennai]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Nair |first1=Aneesh |title=Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy and his Kerala connection |url=https://www.onmanorama.com/sports/cricket/2020/10/28/ipl-2020-varun-chakravarthy-kkr-myster-spinner-kerala-connection.html |access-date=3 March 2025 |work=Manorama Online |date=10 December 2020 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Basu Shanker {{!}} Varun Chakravarthy {{!}} Mystery Spinner {{!}} Cricket {{!}} Interview {{!}} Time Out with Basu {{!}} E15 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uq9gyVkl2qg |access-date=3 March 202

title: Jim_Hanks
summary: This article is about James Mathew Hanks, an American actor and filmmaker born in 1961 who is the younger brother of famous actor Tom Hanks. He has played minor film roles and frequently serves as a voice double for Woody in the Toy Story franchise due to his resemblance to his brother's voice and appearance.
extract: James Mathew Hanks is an American actor and filmmaker. He has played numerous minor roles in film and guest appearances on television. Bearing both a face and a voice that resemble those of his older brother Tom Hanks, he often serves as a voice double for Woody in Toy Story media when the latter is unavailable. He has produced, directed, and filmed several short films. Hanks made his film debut in Buford's Beach Bunnies (1993).

'''James Mathew Hanks''' (born June 15, 1961) is an American actor and filmmaker. He has played numerous minor roles in film and guest appearances on television. Bearing both a face and a voice that resemble those of his older brother [[Tom Hanks]], he often serves as a voice double for [[Woody (Toy Story)|Woody]] in ''[[Toy Story (franchise)|Toy Story]]'' media when the latter is unavailable. He has produced, directed, and filmed several short films. Hanks made his film debut in ''[[Buford's Beach Bunnies]]'' (1993).

==Early life==
James Mathew Hanks was born in [[Shasta County, California]] on June 15, 1961.<ref>{{cite web |title=Hanks, Jim 1961- |url=https://www.encyclopedia.com/education/news-wires-white-papers-and-books/hanks-jim-1961 |website=Encyclopedia.com |access-date=December 19, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210805214728/https://www.encyclopedia.com/education/news-wires-white-papers-and-books/hanks-jim-1961 |archive-date=August 5, 2021}}</ref> He is the son of Janet Marylyn (''née'' Frager)<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.yahoo.com/amphtml/entertainment/tom-hanks-mother-janet-marylyn-194337342.html | title=Tom Hanks' Mother Janet Marylyn Frager Dies: 'She Was the Difference in Many Lives' | date=12 July 2016 }}</ref> and itinerant cook Amos Mefford Hanks.<ref name="tca">Stated on ''[[Inside the Actors Studio]]'', 1999</ref><ref>{{cite book |first=David |last=Gardner |url=https://archive.org/details/tomhanks00gard |url-access=registration |title=Tom Hanks |date=January 1, 1999 |publisher=Blake |isbn=978-1-85782-327-1}}</ref> Hanks is also the youngest brother of fellow actor [[Tom Hanks]] and entomologist [[Larry Hanks]], but they were not raised together.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chicagoreader.com/Bleader/archives/2012/03/30/tom-hanks-is-important-celebrate-him | title=Tom Hanks is important. Celebrate him. | work=Chicago Reader | date=30 March 2012 | access-date=1 May 2017 | author=Warwick, Kevin}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/1984/08/28/tom-hanks-in-the-hot-seat/14f599e2-9bf0-4d3a-87c1-beff99cfb253/ | title=Tom Hanks, in The Hot Seat | newspaper=The Washington Post | date=28 August 1984 | access-date=1 May 2017 | author=Piantadosi, Roger}}</ref><ref>He discusses his brother beginning at 3:00 {{cite news|title=Tom Hanks interview|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YTaxwrcFhHs |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/YTaxwrcFhHs |archive-date=2021-12-21 |url-status=live|access-date=May 4, 2017|work=[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]]|publisher=CBS|date=April 29, 2017}}{{cbignore}}</ref> After their parents divorced, Jim went to [[Red Bluff, California]] with his mother while older siblings Tom, Larry, and Sandra remained with their father. After college, he lived in [[Sacramento]] working as a waiter.<ref name="readingeagle">{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=-1QlAAAAIBAJ&pg=3528,367918&dq=voice+jim-hanks&hl=en|title=Tom Hanks' younger brother finds acting is an adventure|last=Pecchia|first=David|date=January 17, 1995|publisher=[[Reading Eagle]]|access-date=May 28, 2010}}</ref> The agent who employed his actress wife Karen Praxel as a receptionist encouraged him to get into acting.<ref name="readingeagle"/> After he took acting lessons, he moved to Los Angeles in 1992 and began his career with roles in [[B movie|B-movie]]s and commercial voice-overs.

==Career==
He got his first lead role as Jeeter Buford in ''[[Buford's Beach Bunnies]]'' (1993). Wishing to earn the role based on his own abilities, he auditioned as "Jim Matthews" (just his first and a modification of his middle name). While producers noted his "resemblance to [[Tom Hanks]]", he won the role based on his own comedic and acting skills and his relationship to his brother was not revealed until paperwork was completed.<ref name="book1">{{cite book | first1=Michael | last1=Viner | first2=Terrie Maxine | last2=Frankel | title=Tales from the Casting Couch | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bm_QuZUPP9IC&q=%22Jim+Hanks%22+-inpublisher%3Aicon&pg=PA174 | access-date=May 28, 2010 | publisher=

title: Tungsten
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of tungsten (also called wolfram), a chemical element with symbol W and atomic number 74. It details tungsten's remarkable physical properties—including the highest melting point of any element—and describes its various applications in light bulb filaments, X-ray tubes, military projectiles, and especially in tungsten carbide for metalworking, mining, and construction.
extract: Tungsten is a chemical element; it has symbol W and atomic number 74. It is a metal found naturally on Earth almost exclusively in compounds with other elements. It was identified as a distinct element in 1781 and first isolated as a metal in 1783. Its important ores include scheelite and wolframite, the latter lending the element its alternative name.
